titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Stages Theater records, 1978-2017 MS 740
titlestmt.author: Gabby Parker / Amanda Focke / Rebecca Russell

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored offsite at the Library Service Center and require 24-hour notice for retrieval. Please contact the Woodson Research Center at 713-348-2586 or woodson@rice.edu for more information.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-06-17 09:50:07 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.abstract: Stages Theater records contain materials related to play production programs and other production materials from 1978-2016, press clippings, annual gala and events records, administrative records, photographs, and circa 200 audio and video recordings in analog formats such as VHS and audio cassette.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Founded in 1978, Stages has grown to become Houston's leading mid-sized theatre company, the city's sixth largest nonprofit performing arts producer overall, and the largest outside of Houston's downtown theatre district. Stages is one of the region's leading artistic employers, producing an average of 12 productions per year totaling more than 380 performances and welcoming 65,000+ visitors each season.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: Stages Theater records contain materials related to play production programs and other production materials from 1978-2016, press clippings, annual gala and events records, administrative records, photographs, and circa 200 audio and video recordings in analog formats such as VHS and audio cassette.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research, except for the Development series, which includes restricted personal financial data regarding donations and requires written permission from Stages Theater for access, until 2038.
Stored offsite at the Library Service Center and require 24-hour notice for retrieval. Please contact the Woodson Research Center at 713-348-2586 or woodson@rice.edu for more information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Stages Theater records must be facilitated through the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library.

The Woodson Research Center use policy is that researchers assume sole responsibility for any infringement of privacy, literary rights, copyrights, or other rights arising from their use of the archival materials. In addition to any restrictions placed by donors, certain kinds of archival materials are restricted for the life of the creator plus 50 years. These materials include, but are not limited to, student grades, transcripts, and any job applications or recommendations.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: These records were donated by Stages Theater in 2018.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Stages Theater records, 1978-2017, MS 740, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

did.unittitle: Original discs and analysis sheets for captured content
Subseries B: Content printed from discs
Subseries C: Documentation on discs with uncaptured content
3.5" floppy discs with irrelevant content or that are empty
Zip discs which could not be browsed or accessed
Subseries D: External hard drives for Stages audio/video
External hard drives for Stages audio/video, including mezzanine master video files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These external hard drives were provided by the vendor who digitized the content, Scene Savers. They include avi mezzanine master files and mp4 access files for the video, and wav and mp3 files for the audio. The audio files (both wav and mp3) and the access quality video (mp4) have been preserved in the Woodson's nearline environment as AIP numbers MS740aip_064 through MS740aip_071. All the recordings are described in this finding aid, at the item level, as Series VI.

did.unittitle: Sub-Series B: Administration and Board records (boxes 55-68)
Sub-Series F: Early Stages and Young Actors Conservatory (YAC) (boxes 93-101)
